channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipped black bags outside 304 Rangefield Road, 3rd November
item.description:
3 fly tipped black bags. Please remove. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sudbury Crescent, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unknown car have been parked at night suspiciously and standing here for 4 days- no one coming to collect. Parked in private area and disturbing our driving as is no much space. Also scratched the residents car door., 3rd November
item.description:
As we don’t know who is the owner of the car, we are suspicious and worried that something wrong is going on. Vat is untaxed and without MOT- could be stolen? Please, check this matter as our neighbour are all concerned and worried.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sign - Lanridge Road, 3rd November
item.description:
You need to actually fix the street sign. I raised a request as the DUCT TAPE it was affixed to an old sign with had torn and the street sign fell onto the pavement. You've said its fixed when actually its just been propped up. Can you actually fix this properly not a bodge job for once?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lanridge Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox found on pavement, 3rd November
item.description:
Dead fox found on the pavement in the leaves. Across the pavement. It is an obstruction as the reporter nearly kicked it whilst on a run. Please remove
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dropped wet leaves need clearing away, 3rd November
item.description:
There are so many leaves on the pavements and in the roads that are wet and dangerous and slippery. They have not been collected in months even though other roads and areas get cleared all the time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cole Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road breaking up…., 3rd November
item.description:
This patch was repaired a few weeks ago, but was disturbed by the crew relaying the road down Crest View. Can it be repaired again before it gets bigger again?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merton Gardens, Petts Wood, London

item.title: Broken furniture outside hostel, 3rd November
item.description:

item.title: Hedge Blocking Pavement, 3rd November
item.description:
The hedge outside the ground floor flat (30A) Dalberg Road blocks the pavement. When the bins are out, it would be impossible for someone in a wheelchair or pushing a pram to pass. It doesn't seem to have been cut this year at all. Please request that it is cut back to allow pedestrians, including those using wheelchairs or pushing prams, to pass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalberg Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin bags dumped on pavement, 3rd November
item.description:
These bags have been here for a couple of days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkway, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Enormous Hedge Blocking the Pavement, 3rd November
item.description:
Outside 2 Dalberg Road, a huge hedge blocks the pavement. It would be impossible to pass it in a wheelchair or a pram. Nothing has been done about it for months. Please arrange for it to be cut back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalberg Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence keeps falling info pavement, 3rd November
item.description:
This neighbours fence keeps falling onto the pavement even though we have asked them to fix it. I keep putting it back up but it’s causing issues for passing elderly neighbours.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wakefield Road, New Southgate, London
